intro: Theophrasta caloneura, commonly known as the narrow-veined theophrasta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and Botswana. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets. Theophrasta caloneura is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils.
